subject: Psychology
title: The Fundamental Attribution Error
description: One-minute skill: The Fundamental Attribution Error.

hook.text: Someone cuts you off in traffic. 'What a jerk!' you think. But maybe they're rushing to a hospital.

buildup.text: The fundamental attribution error is our tendency to blame others' behavior on their character, not their situation.

discovery.text: Jones and Harris showed people assumed essay writers believed their arguments, even when told the topic was assigned.

twist.text: We do the opposite for ourselves. When we mess up, we blame the situation. When others mess up, we blame them.

climax.text: This bias fuels conflict, judgment, and misunderstanding. Recognizing it is the first step to empathy.

punchline.text: We judge others by their actions, ourselves by our intentions.

quiz.question: What is the fundamental attribution error?
options: Blaming others' behavior on character rather than situation
Attributing our own failures to our character
